data.meaning_mnemonic: You've seen this as a radical before, and the kanji means the same thing — <kanji>south</kanji>!
data.meaning_hint: If you keep up with your radicals, your kanji studies will never go south. Haha! Go south! Get it? I said g—
data.reading_mnemonic: Think about the <kanji>south</kanji>. What's down there? <reading>Mean Amy</reading> (みなみ) lives down there. Think of the last mean thing she did to you and imagine it while yelling out "MEAN AMYYYYY" at the sky.
data.reading_hint: Picture Mean Amy down in the south, saying mean things in her American southern accent: "Y'all don't come back now, ya hear?" Man, Mean Amy is so mean. And southern.
